message.content:
Analysis of the target scene shows it is actually two separate “towers.”  Below is a layer‐by‐layer breakdown of each, followed by which dictionary blocks (by index) match those parts exactly (without re‐orienting them), and finally a suggested build order.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  Left Tower (five layers top to bottom):
   –  Top layer: An orange triangular “roof” piece.  
   –  Just beneath that: A red arch‐shaped block (arch opening forward).
   –  Below the red arch: A green rectangular block spanning left‐to‐right.
   –  Center: A blue cube.
   –  Another green rectangular block bridging across the “U” shapes.
   –  Bottom layer: Two red “U”‐shaped blocks (mirrored) forming the base.

•  Right Tower (five layers top to bottom):
   –  Top layer: Another orange triangular roof piece.
   –  Just beneath that: A cylindrical orange pillar.
   –  Below the pillar: One long yellow rectangular block spanning left‐to‐right.
   –  On either side: Two short green rectangular blocks (one atop each arch).
   –  Bottom layer: Two red arch blocks (a left‐oriented arch and a right‐oriented arch).

Overall Block Count
∙  Left Tower uses 7 pieces.  
∙  Right Tower uses 7 pieces.  
∙  Total = 14 building blocks.

Layers Summary
∙  Left Tower has 5 vertical layers (from the red “U”s at bottom, up through the triangular roof).  
∙  Right Tower has 5 vertical layers (from red arches at bottom, up through the triangular roof).  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE REQUIRED BLOCKS (BY INDEX)
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Below is which dictionary block matches each part (no rotations allowed beyond what is shown in the dictionary):

LEFT TOWER
1) Bottom “U” shapes → red blocks #3 and #4 (mirrored “C”‐shapes).  
2) Blue cube → block #5.  
3) Two horizontal green bars → block #7 used twice.  
4) Top red arch → block #1 (arch opening to front).  
5) Orange triangular roof → block #15.  

RIGHT TOWER
1) Bottom red arches → blocks #1 (left arch) and #2 (right arch).  
2) Two green blocks on top of arches → block #8 used twice (green bar oriented front‐to‐back).  
3) Yellow rectangular block spanning across → block #11.  
4) Orange cylinder → block #12.  
5) Orange triangular roof → block #15.  

Hence the full dictionary‐index list needed (with quantities):

• #1: 2 copies  
• #2: 1 copy  
• #3: 1 copy  
• #4: 1 copy  
• #5: 1 copy  
• #7: 2 copies  
• #8: 2 copies  
• #11: 1 copy  
• #12: 1 copy  
• #15: 2 copies  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP-BY-STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Below is one possible build sequence (first the left tower, then the right).  
Use exactly this format:

{
  Step1: Move block with index 3
  Step2: Move block with index 4
  ...
}

Proposed Instructions:

{
  Step1: Move block with index 3   // Left tower bottom-left “U”
  Step2: Move block with index 4   // Left tower bottom-right “U”
  Step3: Move block with index 7   // First green bar spanning the “U” blocks
  Step4: Move block with index 5   // Blue cube in center
  Step5: Move block with index 7   // Second green bar above the blue cube
  Step6: Move block with index 1   // Red arch on top
  Step7: Move block with index 15  // Orange triangular roof

  Step8:  Move block with index 1  // Right tower bottom-left arch
  Step9:  Move block with index 2  // Right tower bottom-right arch
  Step10: Move block with index 8  // Green block on left arch
  Step11: Move block with index 8  // Green block on right arch
  Step12: Move block with index 11 // Yellow horizontal block across greens
  Step13: Move block with index 12 // Orange cylinder on yellow block
  Step14: Move block with index 15 // Orange triangular roof
}

That completes both towers exactly as shown in the target image.
